Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2010 11:24AM melissa-5-19 wrote: I don't wear any- just donated the silicone ones as they increased my LE and I do have some foam ones from TLC but only wear those to important dressy events- otherwise I am just out there with my flat-chested self and when/if anyone brings it up i use it as an opportunity to educate about BC. I only came to this decision in the last month and thought about it for a while- feel really free and it makes dressing faster......each to their own but this is an option.
Posts.Title: Hot weather and sweating behind breast forms Erica

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2009 10:11PM melissa-5-19 wrote: Call every hospital in your area and ask for the breast cancer nurse navigator-if you find one you will get more information and skinny on local help than ever.  also google the national consortium of breast cancer or NCBC, not sure if it is . org or .com  we were all exactly where you are today and are all hoping the best for you. also no one told me to check in with my primay physician and I needed meds for axniety  but breast surgeon  (BS) wouldn't even consider it and I had NO information for 3 weeks , almost 4. I have an oncologist for another matter that helped me out, I still think it sucks and felt abandon by the BS office... Hope this helps

IF YOU BELIEVE IN KARMA IT MAKES ONE WONDER WHAT IS WAITING FOR THESE FOLKS! PATHOLOGY BACK TONIGHT; DCIS, STAGE 0, HIGH GRADE, 6MM, NODE NEG RT 0/4, LT 0/3, CLEAN WIDE MARGINS! My BMX was on 10/19 and my young and I think naive primary care doc just said "MY DH is a PS and he tells every one 4 weeks to get their energy  back" Who is he speaking to ? certainly not 56 y/o women- Please those who have gone before me- how long did it take for your energy to come back?
Posts.Title: need more support for my decision MicheleS melissa-5-19

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2009 06:43PM melissa-5-19 wrote:  Before you do anything get a complete copy of you medical records from both the surgeons office and the hospital(S). You  will have to sign a release and wait a little and it will give you time to write your letter calmly.  I agree with all of the above but would add one or two more complaints to be made so we have : 1) State Medical Board.  2) Hospital- go to both Risk Management (they do anything NOT to be sued) and the patient advocate - 3) contingent attorney- let them "sort it out when it comes to Risk vs blame" 4, Your Insurance agency AND the State insurance Commissioner 5) no matter your age Medicare- Medicare sets the standard for insurance companies and in addition to Joint Commission they are POWERFUL 6. Joint Commission 7. State Board of Surgeons. 8) the CEO of the hospital- settle for none other that the CEO- they will probably have Risk Management at their side but who cares? 9) get the other two woman as suggested- there are always power in numbers but do not let one another read your letters or make them sound alike- they will be judgmental and think you 3 have a "Bond" which you do bit again so what?  Write one concussive letter with the addresses of each of these agencies and persons, show it to the attorney and mail it to all with Certified mail receipt that someone must sign so that you can prove you notified them.

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2010 02:12PM melissa-5-19 wrote: Susie- dx in 9/09-BMX 10/19/09 - Retiring May 20, 2010, I am happy with my treatment condition, tired of working and honestly nothing is more valuable than the ME and US time I can create- people will be after my job and the work just keeps coming and I am just simply finished! Yes some feel like you do and how ever you feel is right for you- we are all in this together, yet we are individuals and have the right to feel the way we do and act on it- that also means no one else is wrong about the way they feel. Hang in until you come up with your answer. love ya, hugs and smiles your way-
